job_details.Functieomschrijving:
As an Azure Engineer in Accenture Technology - Cloud First, you will play a pivotal role in driving our customers' cloud initiatives, leveraging Microsoft's Azure platform to design, build, migrate, and optimize scalable cloud solutions. Your expertise will be crucial in advancing our customers' cloud adoption strategies, ensuring security, and optimizing their infrastructure through effective use of Azure's vast toolset and frameworks. Join our team and contribute to shaping the future of our customers' cloud infrastructure, leveraging your expertise in Azure to drive innovation and excellence.
     * People You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, system administrators, and project managers, to ensure seamless integration and operation of cloud services for our customers. Your ability to communicate effectively and mentor junior team members will be essential in fostering a collaborative and efficient working environment.
     * Process You will lead the implementation of the Cloud Adoption Framework for our customers, ensuring their processes align with best practices for cloud governance, security, and compliance. Your role will involve refining and enhancing our customers' DevOps processes, facilitating continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI / CD) pipelines, and automating infrastructure management using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Bicep or Terraform.
     * Technology Your in-depth understanding of cloud architecture and Azure's capabilities will be instrumental in designing, building, migrating, and optimizing workloads for robust landing zones and other cloud infrastructure components for our customers. You will utilize Azure DevOps tools and services to streamline project workflows and ensure the reliability and scalability of our customers' cloud environments.
     * Task Day-to-day tasks will include designing and building Azure projects from the ground up for our customers, managing their cloud resources, and ensuring optimal performance and security. You will also be responsible for migrating and optimizing workloads to Azure, troubleshooting and resolving issues related to cloud infrastructure, continuously improving our customers' cloud operations, and staying updated with the latest Azure developments and best practices.

   With all our roles, there is some in-person time for collaboration, learning and building relationships with clients, peers, leaders, and communities. As an employer, we will be as flexible as possible to support your specific work / life needs.
job_details.full_text:
Azure Engineer

As an Azure Engineer in Accenture Technology - Cloud First, you will play a pivotal role in driving our customers' cloud initiatives, leveraging Microsoft's Azure platform to design, build, migrate, and optimize scalable cloud solutions. Your expertise will be crucial in advancing our customers' cloud adoption strategies, ensuring security, and optimizing their infrastructure through effective use of Azure's vast toolset and frameworks. Join our team and contribute to shaping the future of our customers' cloud infrastructure, leveraging your expertise in Azure to drive innovation and excellence.
     * People You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, system administrators, and project managers, to ensure seamless integration and operation of cloud services for our customers. Your ability to communicate effectively and mentor junior team members will be essential in fostering a collaborative and efficient working environment.
     * Process You will lead the implementation of the Cloud Adoption Framework for our customers, ensuring their processes align with best practices for cloud governance, security, and compliance. Your role will involve refining and enhancing our customers' DevOps processes, facilitating continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI / CD) pipelines, and automating infrastructure management using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Bicep or Terraform.
     * Technology Your in-depth understanding of cloud architecture and Azure's capabilities will be instrumental in designing, building, migrating, and optimizing workloads for robust landing zones and other cloud infrastructure components for our customers. You will utilize Azure DevOps tools and services to streamline project workflows and ensure the reliability and scalability of our customers' cloud environments.
     * Task Day-to-day tasks will include designing and building Azure projects from the ground up for our customers, managing their cloud resources, and ensuring optimal performance and security. You will also be responsible for migrating and optimizing workloads to Azure, troubleshooting and resolving issues related to cloud infrastructure, continuously improving our customers' cloud operations, and staying updated with the latest Azure developments and best practices.

   With all our roles, there is some in-person time for collaboration, learning and building relationships with clients, peers, leaders, and communities. As an employer, we will be as flexible as possible to support your specific work / life needs.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on Microsoft Azure platform administration, migration, and optimization, with a strong emphasis on cloud infrastructure and DevOps processes. While it mentions collaboration and process improvement, it lacks specific details about AI/ML model development, generative AI techniques, or advanced data science tasks that would align it with ML Engineer or GenAI Engineer profiles. The core responsibilities and technologies described are characteristic of a cloud infrastructure or DevOps role rather than an AI-focused engineering position.

job_tasks.justification: The job description mentions 'driving our customers' cloud initiatives', 'advancing our customers' cloud adoption strategies', and aligning technical solutions with business goals through the Cloud Adoption Framework.
The role involves understanding customer needs and translating them into cloud solutions.
job_tasks.phrase: advancing our customers' cloud adoption strategies

job_tasks.justification: The role involves designing, building, and migrating cloud solutions, which includes aspects of software development in the context of cloud infrastructure.
job_tasks.phrase: design, build, migrate, and optimize scalable cloud solutions

job_tasks.justification: The description explicitly mentions refining and enhancing DevOps processes, facilitating CI/CD pipelines, and automating infrastructure management.
job_tasks.phrase: refining and enhancing our customers' DevOps processes

job_tasks.justification: The role involves automating infrastructure management using Infrastructure as Code tools.
job_tasks.phrase: automating infrastructure management using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools

job_tasks.justification: Designing and building Azure projects from the ground up is a core software development task within the cloud context.
job_tasks.phrase: designing and building Azure projects from the ground up

job_tasks.justification: Managing cloud resources, ensuring optimal performance and security, and troubleshooting infrastructure issues fall under operations engineering.
Migrating and optimizing workloads to Azure is a key operational task for cloud engineers.
job_tasks.phrase: migrating and optimizing workloads to Azure

job_tasks.justification: Troubleshooting and resolving issues related to cloud infrastructure is a critical part of operations engineering.
job_tasks.phrase: troubleshooting and resolving issues related to cloud infrastructure

job_tasks.justification: Continuously improving cloud operations is a direct responsibility within operations engineering.
job_tasks.phrase: continuously improving our customers' cloud operations

soft_skills.phrase: fostering a collaborative and efficient working environment
staying updated with the latest Azure developments and best practices
troubleshooting and resolving issues related to cloud infrastructure
